snippet: Government aid to low-income workers has increased, but those without jobs, who are in the direst straits, are receiving scant attention, experts say.
abstract: Experts say government aid to people with incomes that are one-half to two times the poverty level has increased since 1983, but to those with incomes less than that it has diminished; shift reflects more conservative political environment and response to broader economic forces like globalization, advancing technology and workers' weakened bargaining strength.
lead_paragraph: Government aid to low-income workers has increased, but those without jobs, who are in the direst straits, are receiving scant attention, experts say.

headline.main: Aid to Needy Often Excludes the Poorest in America
headline.print_headline: A Gaping Hole in the Safety Net
